docs.lead_paragraph: EACH year, 5,000 Long Island teen-agers become pregnant. Many of these teen-agers lack rudimentary reproductive knowledge, a lack that affects the mother, the child and the entire community. Recently there have been efforts to publicize the problem--and to alter the facts.
docs.abstract: Suffolk County (NY) soc worker Sharon S Epstein article describes need for accurate birth control information to reach teen-agers to prevent pregnancies dangerous to physical and emotional health (M)
